intro: Pleiospora grandifolia, commonly known as the large-leaf pleiospora, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, open habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
